Name: Flying Tigre Coctel
Ingredients: 45 ml Light white rum (charcoal-filtered 1-4 years old)
5 ml Sugar syrup 'rich' (2 sugar to 1 water, 65.0°Brix)
2 dash Peychaud's or other Creole-style bitters
15 ml Chilled water reduce if wet ice
Instructions: Select and pre-chill a Martini glass .
Prepare garnish of orange zest twist.
EXPRESS orange zest twist over the cocktail and use as garnish.
Review: Light, aromatic and complex - one to sip.
History: Adapted from a recipe in the 1949 edition of Esquire's Handbook for Hosts . The drink is credited to an unnamed Captain serving in the US Marines, Amphibious Group Seven, at Santiago de Cuba in 1942.
Nutrition: One serving of Flying Tigre Coctel contains 170 calories
